messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: I am deeply disappointed that Oxford West & Abingdon's current Conservative MP voted against Liberal Democrat proposals to reform the 'bedroom tax'. The Affordable Homes Bill, proposed by my Lib Dem colleague Andrew George MP, would make significant changes to how the bedroom tax operates, making it much fairer and helping to protect the most vulnerable. I was glad to see that many Labour MPs also supported the Bill in the Commons.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Proposing the Affordable Homes Bill to make the bedroom tax fairer and protect the most vulnerable.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only 176 votes separated the parties in 2010.

issues.socialWelfare: Proposing reforms to the 'bedroom tax' indicating a focus on social welfare and supporting the most vulnerable.

housing.content: Supporting the Affordable Homes Bill to reform the bedroom tax, impacting housing for the most vulnerable, including those with disabilities and the elderly.

politicalExperience.role: Lib Dem Parliamentary Candidate for Oxford West & Abingdon
